title.native: ステラ女学院高等科C³部（しーきゅーぶ）
title.english: Stella Women's Academy, High School Division Class C3

description:
Yura Yamato has just arrived at the high school division of Stella Women's Academy, when Sonora Kashima invites her to join a club called "C³". Sonora is the third-year student who became the new head of this club for military survival games. The other members include two second-year students (part-Japanese Karila Hatsuse and G36K-wielding Honoka Mutsu) and two other new students (Rento Kirishima whose family runs a Japanese sweets shop and the really short Yachiyo Hinata).

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description:
_Note: Not to be confused with the [painter](https://anilist.co/staff/194863/)._

Affiliated with Atelier Platz.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kz_lt)__

kz (pronounced "k-zet") (also known as RE:NDZ) is one of the early authors of Hatsune Miku songs, and most of his works have become hits, starting with his debut, "Packaged." He is skilled at creating reverberant, technopop pieces with Hatsune Miku. Though he has not been active on Nico Nico Douga since late 2008, he did create the new songs "Far Away" and "Star Story" for the release of the July 2009 Sony PSP game "Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA", and it's July 29, 2010 sequel "Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA 2nd".  kz is the sole member of the amateur music circle livetune who, in late 2007, released an a Vocaloid album titled "Re:package" at Comic Market 73. It was then resold by Victor Entertainment with a major circulation release on August 28, 2008, making it the first Hatsune Miku CD to be sold by a major label.   livetune was originally a 2 member unit, made up by kz and kajyuki. However, kajyuki left in 2008 to work at CAPCOM, leaving kz as the only member.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kz_lt)__

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuiyui_makino) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/yui-makino/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yui_makino0119/) | [Website](http://www.yuiyuimakino.com/)

A Japanese voice actor, singer, and pianist. She married the singer-songwriter [Yutaro Miura](https://anilist.co/staff/182317/Yuutarou-Miura) on June 12, 2020. 
 
Makino took up piano at the age of four. Her talent was discovered by the film director Shunji Iwai when she was only seven years old, and from the age of 8 to 17, she played piano solos for three of his films, one of which was _Love Letter_. She then graduated from Tokyo College of Music as piano major in 2008 with the top score in her senior year piano ensemble.

Makino has appeared in two films, several commercials, and a TV Drama. She also sang the ending theme of a Wii game, Arc Rise Fantasia. The song, which she wrote the lyrics and music of herself, was titled "Tenshi no Hashigo ~crepuscular rays~".

She was nominated for "Best Young Seiyuu"  for her outstanding portrayal of Misaki Nakahara in Welcome To The N.H.K!.

**Non-Anime Roles**
- Zhezhi - Wuthering Waves (VG)

**Height:** 153 cm (5'0)

__[Profile (Osawa)](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/kayanoai/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayanoai_0913) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kayanoai_0913/) | [YouTube Channel Official Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kayanomi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0D6qi-Gr5RW7hqOvTEKmAw)__

__Introduction:__
Ai Kayano is a Japanese voice actress and vocalist currently affiliated with Office Osawa.

__Biography:__
Kayano wanted to work in a job that would involve "healing people", leading to initially take up a course at a vocational school. She worked in the beauty industry and became interested in acting after having seen [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/). While attending school, Kayano continued working in the industry and paid for her tuition.

Kayano began working at Pro-Fit in 2010, voicing two supporting characters in the original video animation [Princess Resurrection](https://anilist.co/anime/9159/). In 2011, she voiced [Meiko "Menma" Honma](https://anilist.co/character/40592/) in [Anohana](https://anilist.co/anime/9989/) and received the Best Rookie Actress award for said role at the 6th Seiyuu Awards. Kayano, [Haruka Tomatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/95890/) and [Saori Hayami](https://anilist.co/staff/95869/) performed the series' ending theme "Secret Base – Kimi ga Kureta Mono (10 years after Ver.)", a cover of a song originally sung by the band Zone.

She is often praised for her vocal range, having voiced a variety of characters such as [Mayaka Ibara](https://anilist.co/character/55137/), [Mashiro Shiina](https://anilist.co/character/61371/), [Darkness](https://anilist.co/character/89363/) and [Akari Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/character/24311/) for example, none of which one would connect to the same voice actress.

**Trivia:**
- Worked part-time at a coffee shop with [Chinatsu Akasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/107652/) before becoming a voice actress.
- She got around 100 suggestions for her nickname in the Anohana radio show, from which she herself picked out Kayanon.

Non-anime roles:
- Atago - Azur Lane
- Graf Zeppelin - Azur Lane
- Kaga - Azur Lane
- Renown - Azur Lane
- Y'shtola Rhul - Final Fantasy XIV

__Height:__ 154 cm (5' 0")
__Hobbies:__ Piano

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/sawashiro-miyuki.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miyuki_Sawashiro) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B2%A2%E5%9F%8E%E3%81%BF%E3%82%86%E3%81%8D)

Began her voice-acting career in 1999 and has continued her work as a seiyuu for more than two decades. Her younger brother [Chiharu Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/120159) is a fellow voice actor.

__Non-anime roles:__~!
• Aggie in "Madeline" (live-action movie)
• Agrias Oaks in "Dissidia Final Fantasy: Opera Omnia" (Smartphone VG) 
• Akane in "ZERO ESCAPE: Jikan no Dilemma" (VG)
• Allie Nodens in "7th Dragon III Code: VFD" (VG)
• Anika in "HIT ～Heroes of Incredible Tales～" 
• Aranea Highwind in "Final Fantasy XV" (VG)
• Archer (Artemis) in "Fate/Grand Order" (VG)
• Aruruu in "Utawarerumono" (VG)
• Aya in "Assassin's Creed: Origins" (VG)
• Azel in "Rune Factory Oceans" (VG)
• Banshinatari in "Granado Espada" (MMORPG) 
• Barbara Gordon / Batgirl in "The Lego Batman Movie" (animated movie)
• Barcia in "The Lost Child" (VG)
• Beelzebub in "J-Stars Victory VS" (VG)
• Berserker (Florence Nightingale) in "Fate/Grand Order" (VG)
• Cal 'Drei' Devens in "Phantom of Inferno" (2011) (VG)
• Camilla in "Fire Emblem Fates" (VG)
• Cammy in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
• Carl Clover in "BlazBlue" (VG)
• Catalina in "Granblue Fantasy" (VG)
• Chidori Yoshino in "Persona 3" (VG)
• Elizabeth in "Persona 3" (VG)
• Raiden Mei in "Honkai Impact 3rd" (VG)
• Raiden Shogun/Raiden Ei in ”Genshin Impact" (VG)
• Acheron in "Honkai Star Rail" (VG)
• Jolyne Cujoh in "JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Eyes of Heaven" (VG)
• Twilight Sparkle in "My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic/Equestria Girls" (animated cartoon & movies)
• Makoto Makimura in "Yakuza 0/Kiwami 2" (VG)!~

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

A close personal friend of [Kozue Amano](https://anilist.co/staff/96937/Kozue-Amano). She was invited on stage to Anime Festival Asia 2011.

In 2013, she married a man from outside the anime industry.

__Non anime roles:__
- Azami - Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (VG)
- Dorothy - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Jean](https://anilist.co/character/190865/Jean-Gunnhildr) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- [Kotori Kanbe](https://anilist.co/character/37486/) - Rewrite (VG)
- Mayer - Arknights (VG)
- [Wakamo Kosaka](https://anilist.co/character/287031/) - Blue Archive (VG)
- Changli - Wuthering Waves (VG)
- Castorice - Honkai Star Rail (VG)
- Metis - Persona 3 Reload : Episode Aigis -The Answer (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/quarter_law) | [Profile](http://www.undecided.co.jp/profile.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%AD%E5%B7%9D%E5%B9%B8%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E)

Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts' school of music. He is the son of musician and trumpet player Yoshihiro Nakagawa and older brother of the trombonist [Eijirou Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/271401/Eijirou-Nakagawa). He has done music for various anime, dramas, films, and tokusatsu shows.

Nakagawa is known for collaborating with director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi), and has written and composed the scores for many of his projects since [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/) in 2001. Including the acclaimed [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Lelouch-of-the-Rebellion/) series. Outside anime, he is also noted for his work on many Super Sentai and Kamen Rider series.

**Notable works outside anime as composer:**
~!- Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2001)
- GoGo Sentai Boukenger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2006)
- Kamen Rider Decade (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider W (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009-10) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider OOO (tokusatsu, TV series, 2010) 
- Kamen Rider Wizard (tokusatsu, TV series, 2012-13)
- Kamen Rider Drive (tokusatsu, TV series, 2014) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider Revice (tokusatsu, TV series, 2021)!~
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/209351/)._
